verb.description: Express complete disapproval of, typically in public; censure.
examples: fair-minded people declined to condemn her on mere suspicion

verb.description: Sentence (someone) to a particular punishment, especially death.
examples: the rebels had been condemned to death

origin: Middle English (in condemn (sense 2)): from Old French condemner, from Latin condemnare, from con- (expressing intensive force) + damnare inflict loss on (see damn).
